Description: Ostracon, fragment of the shoulder of a brown pottery ribbed vessel, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of two lines of Coptic text written in black ink and a red-painted character.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394133) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394133)
